title: How do we find probability in statistics? - Quora

response.answer_text: A probabilistic outcome Probabablity tells you the outcome heads or tails is more likely to occurr in any given event or trial Probablity of a particular outcome is determined by dividing the number of times that the out come has occurred by the total number of events Example: if a coin is tossed the theoritical probability of getting a head will be 1/2 Formula P (E) = number of favourable outcomes/ total number of outcomes
